data: It was about four in the afternoon when the sun, veiled in clouds, with subdued light and tempered beams, enabled Don Quixote to relate, without heat or inconvenience, what he had seen in the cave of Montesinos to his two illustrious hearers, and he began as follows:
The History of Don Quixote, Volume 2, Part 26
Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de, 1547-1616; Dor√©, Gustave, 1832-1883 [Illustrator]; Ormsby, John, 1829-1895 [Translator]
